meanings.definition: A large building or group of buildings fortified against attack with thick walls, battlements, towers, and in many cases a moat.
meanings.sent1: The castle stood tall on the hill, surrounded by a deep moat.
meanings.sent2: The royal family lived in the grand castle overlooking the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The castle's moat was so wide that even the ducks needed a boat to cross.
meanings.sent4: Her home was her castle, a sanctuary from the chaos of the world.
meanings.sent5: The castle's walls whispered tales of battles long past.

meanings.sent1: The mansion looked more like a castle with its towering structure.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman owned a castle-like estate in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The castle of a house had more rooms than they could count.
meanings.sent4: Her dream was to live in a castle of her own, surrounded by gardens.
meanings.sent5: The castle of a home exuded elegance and grandeur at every turn.

meanings.definition: A piece in chess that has the power to move in any direction along a rank or file on which it stands.
meanings.sent1: The castle in chess can move horizontally or vertically across the board.
meanings.sent2: She strategically placed her castle to protect her king in the game.
meanings.sent3: The castle in chess was the silent guardian of the king, ready to strike.
meanings.sent4: His opponent's castle in chess was a formidable obstacle to overcome.
meanings.sent5: The castle in chess was the key player in her winning strategy.
